data.title: ‘Don’t leave your votes at home’, Haradinaj appeals to citizens to take part in the elections
data.meta_description: Kosovo’s former prime minister and leader of the Alliance for the Future of Kosovo (AAK), Ramush Haradinaj, voted this morning at the ballot center set up at the Ali Sokoli high school in Prishtina. After casting his vote, Haradinaj invited all citizens to take the opportunity to exercise their right to vote. Accompanied by his […]
data.text:
Kosovo’s former prime minister and leader of the Alliance for the Future of Kosovo (AAK), Ramush Haradinaj, voted this morning at the ballot center set up at the Ali Sokoli high school in Prishtina.

After casting his vote, Haradinaj invited all citizens to take the opportunity to exercise their right to vote.

Accompanied by his spouse, Haradinaj said that the local government holds distinct importance in the lives of citizens.

“You should all take advantage of your right to vote. I voted as well. Communal government is very important for your lives and for the lives of citizens in every possible direction. I invite you to decide for yourselves. Don’t leave your vote at home,”- said Haradinaj.
